pageContext.claim: “It's been three months, Brian. Three months. Why isn't it moving faster? That's the only thing they can say. Or they say something else: 'He met.' I met. ....With me they say, 'He met.' That was like, you know, this major concession. That's not a concession. I met.”
pageContext.analysis: It was a major concession for Trump to meet one-on-one with North Korean dictator Kim Jong Un without any preconditions and negotiations leading up to that point. Previous U.S. presidents have not wanted to make that step without a sign of a serious commitment by North Korea, given the prestige such a meeting for give the North Korea leader.
